Behavioral Neuroscience: The study of the biological bases of psychological processes and behavior.
Clinical & Community Psychology: The assessment, treatment, and prevention of mental illness at individual and community levels.
Cognitive Neuroscience: The study of the neural mechanisms underlying cognition, often using brain imaging techniques.
Cognitive Psychology: The study of mental processes such as attention, language use, memory, and problem-solving.
Developmental Psychology: The scientific study of how and why human beings change over the course of their life.
Industrial-Organizational Psychology: The application of psychological principles to the workplace to improve productivity and well-being.
Social-Personality Psychology: The study of how individuals' thoughts, feelings, and behaviors are influenced by others and individual differences.
